speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: LUCENTIO
text_entry: SCENE I. On a ship at sea: a tempestuous noise

speaker: Master

speaker: Boatswain
text_entry: the hour, if it so hap. Cheerly, good hearts! Out

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: 'Twould put me to my slipper: but I feel not

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: This deity in my bosom: twenty consciences,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: That stand 'twixt me and Milan, candied be they

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And melt ere they molest! Here lies your brother,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: No better than the earth he lies upon,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: If he were that which now he's like, that's dead;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Whom I, with this obedient steel, three inches of it,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Can lay to bed for ever; whiles you, doing thus,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To the perpetual wink for aye might put

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: This ancient morsel, this Sir Prudence, who

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Should not upbraid our course. For all the rest,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: They'll take suggestion as a cat laps milk;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: They'll tell the clock to any business that

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: We say befits the hour.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Thy case, dear friend,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Shall be my precedent; as thou got'st Milan,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I'll come by Naples. Draw thy sword: one stroke

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Shall free thee from the tribute which thou payest;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And I the king shall love thee.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Draw together;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And when I rear my hand, do you the like,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To fall it on Gonzalo.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: O, but one word.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: They talk apart

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Re-enter ARIEL, invisible

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: My master through his art foresees the danger

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: That you, his friend, are in; and sends me forth--

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: For else his project dies--to keep them living.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Sings in GONZALO's ear

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: While you here do snoring lie,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Open-eyed conspiracy

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: His time doth take.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: If of life you keep a care,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Shake off slumber, and beware:

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Awake, awake!

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Then let us both be sudden.

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: Now, good angels

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: Preserve the king.

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: They wake

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Why, how now? ho, awake! Why are you drawn?

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Wherefore this ghastly looking?

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: What's the matter?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Whiles we stood here securing your repose,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Even now, we heard a hollow burst of bellowing

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Like bulls, or rather lions: did't not wake you?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: It struck mine ear most terribly.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: I heard nothing.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: O, 'twas a din to fright a monster's ear,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To make an earthquake! sure, it was the roar

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Of a whole herd of lions.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Heard you this, Gonzalo?

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: Upon mine honour, sir, I heard a humming,

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: And that a strange one too, which did awake me:

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: I shaked you, sir, and cried: as mine eyes open'd,

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: I saw their weapons drawn: there was a noise,

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: That's verily. 'Tis best we stand upon our guard,

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: Or that we quit this place; let's draw our weapons.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Lead off this ground; and let's make further search

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: For my poor son.

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: Heavens keep him from these beasts!

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: For he is, sure, i' the island.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Lead away.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Prospero my lord shall know what I have done:

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: So, king, go safely on to seek thy son.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: SCENE II. Another part of the island.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Enter CALIBAN with a burden of wood. A noise of thunder heard

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: All the infections that the sun sucks up

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: From bogs, fens, flats, on Prosper fall and make him

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: By inch-meal a disease! His spirits hear me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And yet I needs must curse. But they'll nor pinch,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Fright me with urchin--shows, pitch me i' the mire,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Nor lead me, like a firebrand, in the dark

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Out of my way, unless he bid 'em; but

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For every trifle are they set upon me;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Sometime like apes that mow and chatter at me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And after bite me, then like hedgehogs which

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Lie tumbling in my barefoot way and mount

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Their pricks at my footfall; sometime am I

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: All wound with adders who with cloven tongues

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do hiss me into madness.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Enter TRINCULO

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Lo, now, lo!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Here comes a spirit of his, and to torment me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For bringing wood in slowly. I'll fall flat;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Perchance he will not mind me.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Here's neither bush nor shrub, to bear off

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: any weather at all, and another storm brewing;

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I hear it sing i' the wind: yond same black

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: cloud, yond huge one, looks like a foul

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: bombard that would shed his liquor. If it

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: should thunder as it did before, I know not

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: where to hide my head: yond same cloud cannot

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: choose but fall by pailfuls. What have we

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: here? a man or a fish? dead or alive? A fish:

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: he smells like a fish; a very ancient and fish-

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: like smell; a kind of not of the newest Poor-

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: John. A strange fish! Were I in England now,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: as once I was, and had but this fish painted,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: not a holiday fool there but would give a piece

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: of silver: there would this monster make a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: man; any strange beast there makes a man:

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: when they will not give a doit to relieve a lame

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: beggar, they will lazy out ten to see a dead

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Indian. Legged like a man and his fins like

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: arms! Warm o' my troth! I do now let loose

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: my opinion; hold it no longer: this is no fish,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: but an islander, that hath lately suffered by a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: thunderbolt.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Thunder

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Alas, the storm is come again! my best way is to

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: creep under his gaberdine; there is no other

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: shelter hereabouts: misery acquaints a man with

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: strange bed-fellows. I will here shroud till the

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: dregs of the storm be past.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Enter STEPHANO, singing: a bottle in his hand

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I shall no more to sea, to sea,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Here shall I die ashore--

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This is a very scurvy tune to sing at a man's

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: funeral: well, here's my comfort.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Drinks

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Sings

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: The master, the swabber, the boatswain and I,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: The gunner and his mate

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Loved Mall, Meg and Marian and Margery,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: But none of us cared for Kate;

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: For she had a tongue with a tang,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Would cry to a sailor, Go hang!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: She loved not the savour of tar nor of pitch,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Yet a tailor might scratch her where'er she did itch:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Then to sea, boys, and let her go hang!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This is a scurvy tune too: but here's my comfort.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Drinks

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do not torment me: Oh!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: What's the matter? Have we devils here? Do you put

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: tricks upon's with savages and men of Ind, ha? I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: have not scaped drowning to be afeard now of your

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: four legs; for it hath been said, As proper a man as

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: ever went on four legs cannot make him give ground;

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and it shall be said so again while Stephano

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: breathes at's nostrils.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The spirit torments me; Oh!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This is some monster of the isle with four legs, who

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: hath got, as I take it, an ague. Where the devil

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: should he learn our language? I will give him some

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: relief, if it be but for that. if I can recover him

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and keep him tame and get to Naples with him, he's a

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: present for any emperor that ever trod on neat's leather.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do not torment me, prithee; I'll bring my wood home faster.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: He's in his fit now and does not talk after the

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: wisest. He shall taste of my bottle: if he have

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: never drunk wine afore will go near to remove his

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: fit. If I can recover him and keep him tame, I will

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: not take too much for him; he shall pay for him that

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: hath him, and that soundly.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou dost me yet but little hurt; thou wilt anon, I

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: know it by thy trembling: now Prosper works upon thee.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come on your ways; open your mouth; here is that

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: which will give language to you, cat: open your

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: mouth; this will shake your shaking, I can tell you,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and that soundly: you cannot tell who's your friend:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: open your chaps again.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I should know that voice: it should be--but he is

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: drowned; and these are devils: O defend me!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Four legs and two voices: a most delicate monster!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: His forward voice now is to speak well of his

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: friend; his backward voice is to utter foul speeches

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and to detract. If all the wine in my bottle will

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: recover him, I will help his ague. Come. Amen! I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: will pour some in thy other mouth.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Stephano!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Doth thy other mouth call me? Mercy, mercy! This is

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: a devil, and no monster: I will leave him; I have no

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: long spoon.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Stephano! If thou beest Stephano, touch me and

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: speak to me: for I am Trinculo--be not afeard--thy

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: good friend Trinculo.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: If thou beest Trinculo, come forth: I'll pull thee

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: by the lesser legs: if any be Trinculo's legs,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: these are they. Thou art very Trinculo indeed! How

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: camest thou to be the siege of this moon-calf? can

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: he vent Trinculos?

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I took him to be killed with a thunder-stroke. But

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: art thou not drowned, Stephano? I hope now thou art

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: not drowned. Is the storm overblown? I hid me

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: under the dead moon-calf's gaberdine for fear of

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: the storm. And art thou living, Stephano? O

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Stephano, two Neapolitans 'scaped!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Prithee, do not turn me about; my stomach is not constant.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: [Aside]  These be fine things, an if they be

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: not sprites.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: That's a brave god and bears celestial liquor.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I will kneel to him.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: How didst thou 'scape? How camest thou hither?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: swear by this bottle how thou camest hither. I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: escaped upon a butt of sack which the sailors

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: heaved o'erboard, by this bottle; which I made of

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: the bark of a tree with mine own hands since I was

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: cast ashore.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll swear upon that bottle to be thy true subject;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: for the liquor is not earthly.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Here; swear then how thou escapedst.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Swum ashore. man, like a duck: I can swim like a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: duck, I'll be sworn.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Here, kiss the book. Though thou canst swim like a

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: duck, thou art made like a goose.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: O Stephano. hast any more of this?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: The whole butt, man: my cellar is in a rock by the

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: sea-side where my wine is hid. How now, moon-calf!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: how does thine ague?

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Hast thou not dropp'd from heaven?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Out o' the moon, I do assure thee: I was the man i'

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: the moon when time was.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I have seen thee in her and I do adore thee:

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: My mistress show'd me thee and thy dog and thy bush.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come, swear to that; kiss the book: I will furnish

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: it anon with new contents swear.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: By this good light, this is a very shallow monster!

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I afeard of him! A very weak monster! The man i'

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: the moon! A most poor credulous monster! Well

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: drawn, monster, in good sooth!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll show thee every fertile inch o' th' island;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And I will kiss thy foot: I prithee, be my god.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: By this light, a most perfidious and drunken

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: monster! when 's god's asleep, he'll rob his bottle.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll kiss thy foot; I'll swear myself thy subject.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come on then; down, and swear.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I shall laugh myself to death at this puppy-headed

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: monster. A most scurvy monster! I could find in my

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: heart to beat him,--

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come, kiss.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: But that the poor monster's in drink: an abominable monster!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll show thee the best springs; I'll pluck thee berries;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll fish for thee and get thee wood enough.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: A plague upon the tyrant that I serve!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll bear him no more sticks, but follow thee,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou wondrous man.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: A most ridiculous monster, to make a wonder of a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Poor drunkard!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I prithee, let me bring thee where crabs grow;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And I with my long nails will dig thee pignuts;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Show thee a jay's nest and instruct thee how

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: To snare the nimble marmoset; I'll bring thee

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: To clustering filberts and sometimes I'll get thee

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Young scamels from the rock. Wilt thou go with me?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I prithee now, lead the way without any more

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: talking. Trinculo, the king and all our company

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: else being drowned, we will inherit here: here;

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: bear my bottle: fellow Trinculo, we'll fill him by

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and by again.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: [Sings drunkenly]

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Farewell master; farewell, farewell!

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: A howling monster: a drunken monster!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: No more dams I'll make for fish

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Nor fetch in firing

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: At requiring;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Nor scrape trencher, nor wash dish

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: 'Ban, 'Ban, Cacaliban

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Has a new master: get a new man.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Freedom, hey-day! hey-day, freedom! freedom,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: hey-day, freedom!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: O brave monster! Lead the way.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: SCENE I. Before PROSPERO'S Cell.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Enter FERDINAND, bearing a log

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: There be some sports are painful, and their labour

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Delight in them sets off: some kinds of baseness

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Are nobly undergone and most poor matters

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Point to rich ends. This my mean task

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Would be as heavy to me as odious, but

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The mistress which I serve quickens what's dead

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And makes my labours pleasures: O, she is

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Ten times more gentle than her father's crabbed,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And he's composed of harshness. I must remove

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Some thousands of these logs and pile them up,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Upon a sore injunction: my sweet mistress

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Weeps when she sees me work, and says, such baseness

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Had never like executor. I forget:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: But these sweet thoughts do even refresh my labours,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Most busy lest, when I do it.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Enter MIRANDA; and PROSPERO at a distance, unseen

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Alas, now, pray you,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Work not so hard: I would the lightning had

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Burnt up those logs that you are enjoin'd to pile!

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Pray, set it down and rest you: when this burns,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: 'Twill weep for having wearied you. My father

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Is hard at study; pray now, rest yourself;

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: He's safe for these three hours.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: O most dear mistress,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The sun will set before I shall discharge

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What I must strive to do.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: If you'll sit down,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I'll bear your logs the while: pray, give me that;

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I'll carry it to the pile.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No, precious creature;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I had rather crack my sinews, break my back,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Than you should such dishonour undergo,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: While I sit lazy by.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: It would become me

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: As well as it does you: and I should do it

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: With much more ease; for my good will is to it,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: And yours it is against.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Poor worm, thou art infected!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: This visitation shows it.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: You look wearily.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No, noble mistress;'tis fresh morning with me

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: When you are by at night. I do beseech you--

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Chiefly that I might set it in my prayers--

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What is your name?

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Miranda.--O my father,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I have broke your hest to say so!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Admired Miranda!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Indeed the top of admiration! worth

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What's dearest to the world! Full many a lady

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I have eyed with best regard and many a time

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The harmony of their tongues hath into bondage

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Brought my too diligent ear: for several virtues

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Have I liked several women; never any

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: With so fun soul, but some defect in her

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Did quarrel with the noblest grace she owed

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And put it to the foil: but you, O you,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: So perfect and so peerless, are created

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Of every creature's best!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: These three have robb'd me; and this demi-devil--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For he's a bastard one--had plotted with them

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To take my life. Two of these fellows you

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Must know and own; this thing of darkness!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Acknowledge mine.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I shall be pinch'd to death.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Is not this Stephano, my drunken butler?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: He is drunk now: where had he wine?

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: And Trinculo is reeling ripe: where should they

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Find this grand liquor that hath gilded 'em?

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: How camest thou in this pickle?

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I have been in such a pickle since I

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: saw you last that, I fear me, will never out of

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: my bones: I shall not fear fly-blowing.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Why, how now, Stephano!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: O, touch me not; I am not Stephano, but a cramp.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: You'ld be king o' the isle, sirrah?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I should have been a sore one then.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: This is a strange thing as e'er I look'd on.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Pointing to Caliban

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: He is as disproportion'd in his manners

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As in his shape. Go, sirrah, to my cell;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Take with you your companions; as you look

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To have my pardon, trim it handsomely.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Ay, that I will; and I'll be wise hereafter

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And seek for grace. What a thrice-double ass

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Was I, to take this drunkard for a god

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And worship this dull fool!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Go to; away!

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Hence, and bestow your luggage where you found it.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Or stole it, rather.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Exeunt CALIBAN, STEPHANO, and TRINCULO

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Sir, I invite your highness and your train

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To my poor cell, where you shall take your rest

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For this one night; which, part of it, I'll waste

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With such discourse as, I not doubt, shall make it

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Go quick away; the story of my life

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And the particular accidents gone by

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Since I came to this isle: and in the morn

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I'll bring you to your ship and so to Naples,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Where I have hope to see the nuptial

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of these our dear-beloved solemnized;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And thence retire me to my Milan, where

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Every third thought shall be my grave.

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: I long

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: To hear the story of your life, which must

speaker: ALONSO
text_entry: Take the ear strangely.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I'll deliver all;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And promise you calm seas, auspicious gales

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And sail so expeditious that shall catch

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Your royal fleet far off.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Aside to ARIEL

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: My Ariel, chick,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: That is thy charge: then to the elements

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Be free, and fare thou well! Please you, draw near.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: EPILOGUE

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: SPOKEN BY PROSPERO

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Now my charms are all o'erthrown,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And what strength I have's mine own,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which is most faint: now, 'tis true,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I must be here confined by you,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Or sent to Naples. Let me not,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Since I have my dukedom got

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And pardon'd the deceiver, dwell

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: In this bare island by your spell;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: But release me from my bands

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With the help of your good hands:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Gentle breath of yours my sails

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Must fill, or else my project fails,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which was to please. Now I want

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Spirits to enforce, art to enchant,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And my ending is despair,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Unless I be relieved by prayer,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which pierces so that it assaults

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Mercy itself and frees all faults.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As you from crimes would pardon'd be,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Let your indulgence set me free.
